system.description:
You are almost universally respected by those of your culture (or those whose family once was) and are expected to share your knowledge with themâ€”teaching traditional arts, performing religious ceremonies, and the like. In exchange, such communities (which may be neighborhoods, districts, settlements, or similar groups) will provide you and your companions food, lodging, and a moderate lifestyle.

Alternately, the Narrator may say that you have similarly caught the interest of other such groups, such as academic institutions or fellow historians, and can gain the same benefit from them.
